name: Degibna and Higher Pentire walk, Penrose

ai.summary: A scenic 8.7 km moderate walk around Degibna and Higher Pentire near Penrose, combining coastal views, woodland trails and rolling heathland. The route offers varied scenery and manageable elevation changes for hikers with a reasonable fitness.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixture of coastal paths along cliffs, woodland trails, and open grassy sections. Expect uneven ground, stiles, and occasional rocky or muddy patches. Some exposed coastal stretches and gentle ascents/descents; footwear with good grip is advised.
ai.safety_notes: Check tide times if coastal segments are involved; stay well back from cliff edges and heed any warning signs. Wear sturdy waterproof footwear and layered clothing for changing conditions. Carry a map or GPS, a charged phone, and a basic first-aid kit. Bring sufficient water and snacks, and keep dogs under control. Inform someone of your planned route and expected return time.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Navigation: map, compass, or GPS; fully charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) for milder weather and coastal views; summer offers long daylight hours; autumn provides quieter trails; winter can be windy, muddy and darker.

seo.title: Degibna and Higher Pentire Walk, Penrose — 8.7 km Moderate Coastal Hike in Cornwall, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Degibna and Higher Pentire Walk, an 8.7 km moderate route around Penrose featuring coast, woodlands and rolling heath. Tips on terrain, safety and gear.
